channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: A shooting caused hundreds of people to flee for safety from the Fourth of July parade in Highland Park, Illinois, the authorities said. The Lake County Sheriff’s Office urged people to stay away from the area. https://t.co/eAPvRxNX9r

In Ukraine, volunteers with limited training are increasingly heading into the kind of battles that test even the most experienced soldiers. Their bodies are being returned to fill up cemeteries in largely peaceful cities and towns in the country’s west. https://t.co/uh0iYP5Atd https://t.co/qjSGorMTro

Breaking News: Five people were killed and 16 were hospitalized in the shooting at a Fourth of July parade in Highland Park, north of Chicago. The police are still searching for the gunman.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/db3NboaX9j

In Opinion
“If Trump runs again, the Democratic Party had better put its strongest opponent forward to stop him,” Bret Stephens tells Gail Collins in their latest conversation. “God love Biden, but he ain’t it.” https://t.co/mcatlNuZaI

A central theme of Kremlin propaganda about the war in Ukraine is that the country's government and culture are filled with dangerous Nazis. These false claims started on state media, but smaller news sites have gone on to amplify the messages. https://t.co/M7la0G1VIN

Sixty years after the execution of Adolf Eichmann, the Nazi war criminal, his confessions have been aired in a new documentary.
Hours of tape recordings expose Eichmann's visceral, ideological antisemitism and his role in the mechanics of mass murder. https://t.co/2lPxpVKWLI https://t.co/vsqCqmZOHc

News Analysis: Former President Donald Trump has weathered scandals by keeping his intentions under wraps, Peter Baker writes. But recent testimony paints a stark portrait of a man willing to do almost anything to hang onto power. https://t.co/iZosXOem0T

A new generation of women activists opposing abortion rights — often pointed to by anti-abortion leaders as the face of the movement — say they are poised to continue the fight in a post-Roe nation. https://t.co/BoiNtFmvqU

The police chief in Akron, Ohio, said officers shot Jayland Walker more than 60 times. Police reported gunfire from Walker’s vehicle after attempting to pull him over but confirmed he was unarmed at the time he was chased on foot and killed. https://t.co/aL7NLyhuLM https://t.co/JlOJ0BpIq9

Vladimir Zelenko, a self-described "simple country doctor" who rocketed to prominence in the early days of the Covid-19 pandemic when his unfounded treatment using hydroxychloroquine gained White House support, died on Thursday. He was 48. https://t.co/gBxXPKkxZ1

Jayland Walker, a 25-year-old Black man who was killed by officers in Akron, Ohio, suffered more than 60 gunshot wounds but was unarmed, the police chief said. Police released footage that showed officers’ actions but deepened questions around his death. https://t.co/S8bdppq48D

These seven questions will help couples check in, whether they're in a relationship that is still reeling from the pandemic, or long ago dove back into old routines without pausing to touch base. https://t.co/ZsSfAM5CJB https://t.co/88BJEbNeoT

The "American Cancer Society of Michigan" and many other fake charities had the same mailbox at one Staten Island location. Here's how the IRS missed a clear fraud. https://t.co/pHxlBDx500 https://t.co/hLLwtfLzZH

The chief security officer of the Supreme Court has asked that Virginia and Maryland officials enforce laws that would prohibit protests outside the homes of justices after weeks of demonstrations favoring abortion rights. https://t.co/y5sLKmhm05

Breaking News: Several people at a Copenhagen shopping mall have been shot and one person has been arrested in connection with the shooting.
The shooting happened at Field’s, the largest shopping center in Denmark. https://t.co/I9AoeHALSQ

Charles Bausman, a former financial executive who runs websites that promote far-right views, recorded footage in the Capitol for a Russian television producer. Soon after, he fled to Moscow as a "political refugee." https://t.co/GGykX6zOuC

The driver of a truck that could top 350 miles per hour because it was powered by jet engines died after the vehicle crashed while racing two airplanes at an air show in Michigan. https://t.co/ZPiIBOFGyu

For five years, the most famous clock tower in Britain was hidden behind an ugly fortress of scaffolding, its hourly bong rendered mute. But this summer, a sound familiar to Londoners for more than 160 years will again ring out — Big Ben is back. https://t.co/ku5z3w30OF https://t.co/zmGm9Wp1Nu

In Opinion
"The right to contraception could be the next to fall," writes @MaraGay, a member of the editorial board. "Why? Because many in this movement are animated by an insatiable desire to punish women who have sex on our own terms and enjoy it." https://t.co/oIBwuOkVMa
This special technique for grilling corn uses a side pan of honey butter to thoroughly drench the corn in flavor while keeping it hot and juicy until you’re ready to eat. https://t.co/4mmckru0YQ
Breaking News: The Uvalde schools police chief who directed the response to the elementary school mass shooting resigned from his city council position. https://t.co/BVwK6CiTEb

An unspecified number of police officers in Akron, Ohio, were put on administrative leave after the fatal shooting of Jayland Walker, a 25-year-old Black man. The city braced for protests that could follow the release on Sunday of video of the shooting. https://t.co/QM7WTz0Lbx
This easy, delicious key lime pie takes just 30 minutes of prep (plus 3 hours’ freezing). https://t.co/F5eZgWVsSg https://t.co/29aEAfDg8z

Vladimir Zelenko, a self-described "simple country doctor" who rocketed to prominence in the early days of the Covid-19 pandemic when his unfounded treatment using hydroxychloroquine gained White House support, died on Thursday. He was 48. https://t.co/T3CxLQ5QSa

Google said that it would delete abortion clinic visits from the location history of its users, in the company’s first effort to address how it will handle sensitive data in the wake of the Supreme Court overturning Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/fGRnTl9Fsn
Donald Trump has accelerated his campaign planning, hoping a White House bid will blunt a series of damaging revelations. Some Republicans are worried. https://t.co/E7K0kGyGd5 https://t.co/hPkWO7DWfD

Three law enforcement officers were killed and three other officers were shot after a man barricaded in his home opened fire with a rifle in Allen, Kentucky — a rural town so small that it lacks its own police force. https://t.co/S87iaTycRI

While Russia has concentrated on fighting for control of the eastern Donbas region, Ukraine has made a series of strategic gains in the south on another critical front in the war. https://t.co/llJHAHGkVR

New Zealand's government said that the Proud Boys' involvement in the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol was "consistent with the definition of a terrorist act." It is now illegal for New Zealanders to participate in or support the group's activities. https://t.co/PLywsUvNaE
Breaking News: The Texas Supreme Court allowed a 1925 law banning abortion to take effect, overturning a lower court ruling that had blocked it. https://t.co/OHWm61Mo3q

President Joko Widodo of Indonesia traveled to Ukraine and Russia this week in the hopes of opening a dialogue that could end the war. But he concluded his trip with little to show for it. https://t.co/VRwe1Db3gS
After two years of tumult, these essential conversations can help couples talk about what’s working, what’s not and where the relationship is headed. https://t.co/xvNZeDVImr https://t.co/0hN17v7JWL

Experts believe that a woolly mammoth unearthed last month in the Klondike gold fields of the Yukon of Canada had been preserved in the frozen ground for more than 30,000 years. https://t.co/JBRTEXcT6x
"Cacio e pepe" can be a verb, as evidenced by this cacio e pepe'd corn on the cob recipe. https://t.co/K2J8zb4bfz https://t.co/3Xia7hKHQA

New York City suddenly removed its high profile, color-coded coronavirus alert system this week — just as newer Omicron subvariants are fueling another rise in cases and hospitalizations. https://t.co/HdMSEeUi4K

The most advanced weapons that the U.S. has so far supplied Ukraine, including rocket launchers, are making an impact in their first days on the battlefield, destroying Russian ammunition depots and command centers, American and Ukrainian officials say. https://t.co/erki99efnB

This week's testimony by 26-year-old Cassidy Hutchinson pulled back the curtain on Washington: a capital helmed largely by the geriatric set, fueled by recent college graduates — many of whom have a front-row seat to moments that can define the country. https://t.co/XsM5QM51oY

Two days after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, a 27-year old woman, T., delivered her fourth child, Cason.
Born after his mother fled domestic abuse and was denied an abortion, he is among the first of many post-Roe babies expected in Texas. https://t.co/sNUqHyKXEB
Breaking News: New York lawmakers passed a bill prohibiting firearms in many public places, a week after the Supreme Court struck down a state gun control law. https://t.co/Wbo0ELlAdg

Kaleem Ullah Khan has spent a lifetime grafting hundreds of types of mango onto a 120-year-old tree in northern India. His decades of experimentation have earned him fame as the “mango man.” https://t.co/5uOrqk2cMF https://t.co/4lK6txxzLf

The Supreme Court has moved relentlessly to the right, issuing blockbuster decisions on cases from abortion to climate change that will transform U.S. life. By one standard measurement, the term that ended this week was the most conservative since 1931. https://t.co/Cjeixw0dIe https://t.co/0kksaof87y

Manchester United spent $242 million on center-backs and got worse. The Premier League club conceded 57 goals last season, their highest total since 1979. Here’s what needs to change. (via @TheAthleticUK) https://t.co/NSp3m7QYHj
These vegetarian recipes range from minimum effort to medium, but all deliver hugely flavorful results— and are a thrill to grill on Independence Day. https://t.co/UKEio2c4K7 https://t.co/Sle9yu2opg
President Biden said that Americans could expect to continue paying higher gas prices for "as long as it takes" so that Russia cannot "defeat Ukraine and move beyond Ukraine." https://t.co/mPMSDUcZvB

The WNBA star Brittney Griner arrived at a Russian court for the start of a trial on drug charges. Legal experts said it was all but certain to end in a conviction.
Follow updates. https://t.co/sMFmTDBJ5L https://t.co/MVZflzq2gP

New Zealand's government said that the Proud Boys' involvement in the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol was "consistent with the definition of a terrorist act." It is now illegal for New Zealanders to participate in or support the group's activities. https://t.co/tZsKa2u2us

New York City is creating the first mobile testing units in the U.S. that will allow people who test positive for the coronavirus to immediately receive for free the antiviral treatment Paxlovid. https://t.co/a3uzndOwPW

Advice urging women to delete their period tracker apps went viral after Roe v. Wade was overturned.
But experts say other digital information is more likely to put women at risk or reveal an illegal abortion. https://t.co/nhKwltjTaX https://t.co/FBcZozjtVW

Over 15 years of documents reveal that McKinsey & Company gave companies an "in-depth experience in narcotics," a New York Times investigation found. From poppy fields to pills, they show how the consulting firm was at the core of the opioid epidemic. https://t.co/1uESF4mEpR https://t.co/JHymjIA0IX

President Biden said he directed his legal team to work with the Justice Dept. and other federal agencies to “find ways that we can, under federal law, continue protecting Americans from harmful pollution, including pollution that causes climate change.” https://t.co/vXPKlG4Qf2
